comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Looks to me like exactly the same team labeled "Rutgers 1915" in the next photo...

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: You are right about that. Looks like Bain screwed up. Hamilton Fish's All-Stars, a team of former , mostly Ivy League, football stars played Rutgers' 1915 team at the Polo Grounds 11/13/15. So this team is either one or the other of those two. I think they look older than 22, so I will say All-Stars, but that's pretty subjective. Hamilton Fish, pictured separately, played for his team that day. See notes under An account of the game gives the lineup that actually played, as opposed to the many names Fish floated in the runup to the event: Herman Schramm, Yale Charley Hahn, Harvard Theodore "Ted" Whithington Al Journeay, Penn Harry Kersberg, Penn Hamilton Fish, Harvard ? Goddard, Springfield Training Frank Fisher, Oberlin Ole Moffatt, Penn Louis Stimson, Oberlin Brad Streit, Princeton That's just 11, and there are 15 in the picture.
